string-array.name: explanationTextList
string-array.item: The Trachtenberg system is a system of rapid mental calculation. The system consists of a number of readily memorized operations that allow one to perform arithmetic computations very quickly. It was developed by the Russian Jewish engineer Jakow Trachtenberg in order to keep his mind occupied while being held in a Nazi concentration camp. (Wikipedia)

It's implemented by the algorithm

a(digit at i) x b(digit at(n-i))

Start by Multiplying the last digits
Continue this to find the last Four digits of the Answer \n\nClick Next Practice

string-array.name: answerTextList
string-array.item: The units digit of 9 x 6 = 54 -> 4\n\nThe first digit in our answer is 4

The units digit of 8 x 6 = 48 -> 8

5 + 5 + 8 = 18
The second Digit is 8
We carry the 1 to the next digit
The units digit of 9 x 4 = 36 -> 6 Plus\n\n1 + 6
The tens digit of 9 x 5 = 45 -> 4 Plus\n\n1 + 6 + 4
The units digit of 8 x 5 = 40 -> 0 Plus\n\n1 + 6 + 4 + 0

The units digit of 7 x 6 = 42 -> 2

1 + 6 + 4 + 0 + 4 + 2 = 17

The third digit in the answer is 7
Carry 1 to the next digit
The units digit of 9 Ã— 3 = 27 -> 7 Plus\n\n1 + 7
The tens digit of 9 x 4 = 36 -> 3 Plus\n\n1 + 7 + 3
The units digit of 8 x 4 = 32 -> 2 Plus\n\n1 + 7 + 3 + 2
The tens digit of 8 x 5 = 40 -> 4 Plus\n\n1 + 7 + 3 + 2 + 4

The tens digit of 7 x 6 = 42 -> 4

1 + 7 + 3 + 2 + 4 + 5 + 4 = 26

The fourth digit is 6
Carry the two forward to the next digits
